column3: str
Staelwyrn is up in arms, as his hired hands are nowhere to be found.
The pirates-turned-yeomen, five in all, are somewhere about Summerford Farms. Find them and send them to Staelwyrn.
You have tracked down and spoken with all five yeoman. Report back to Staelwyrn.
All of the yeomen except Sevrin have returned to work. It is remarkable what lengths some will venture to in order to shirk responsibility.
Speak with the slacking yeomen.
Report to Staelwyrn.
That sea-sloth Sevrin and his lot─never around when there's work to be done!
I'd sooner hire you, but then the rapscallions would never learn.
Find 'em and let 'em know Staelwyrn wants a word with 'em... And don't take “no” for an answer!
Aye, I'm Sevrin. You the old man's errand boy, now?
Tell Staelwyrn not to wet his britches. I'll be there.
Oh, and just so we're clear, I don't care for landlubbers. Go find the chocobo you rode in on, and ride on out.
So, Staelwyrn sent you. And what do you reckon I say to that?
What does the yeoman say?
Work is for the weak and witless.
I've saucier seeds to sow.
Indeed! I didn't get where I am taking guff from glorified gardeners! But I suppose I'll just do the job to shut him up.
This axe was made for splitting skulls, not stumps! You know what I did in my sailing days?
What did the yeoman do aboard the ship?
Skirmishing.
Surgery.
You bet your beard I did! And I've still got an axe to grind, but perhaps I'll just take it out on the trees.
How am I supposed to work on an empty stomach? Gander a guess at what I had for breakfast.
What was the yeoman's breakfast?
Breaded sticks.
Splintery pea soup.
Exactly! The flavor was wooden to say the least. Nevertheless, though I'd rather eat so I can work, for now I'd better work so I can eat.
Textless
Work? Ha! My hands are full liftin' this mug. What do you think's in it?
What is in the yeoman's mug?
Swill water.
Swill wine.
Textless
You're smarter than you look! Might be worth a day's work, if it'll afford me a taste of proper grog, aye.
You done well, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>. All but Sevrin accounted for.
It's no fault of yours he squirmed out─I've let that little worm slip through my grasp too many times.
Next time I see him, I'll put that worm in the dirt, where he belongs.
